Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tobramycin-Impregnated Bone Cement in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: 15 patients undergoing primary TKA were randomly assigned

Intervention.evidence: intervention group (n=10) receiving tobramycin-impregnated bone cement or the control group (n=5) receiving standard intravenous tobramycin

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the efficacy of tobramycin-impregnated bone cement

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intraarticular tobramycin concentration.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a blinded envelope method.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 15 patients undergoing primary TKA were randomly assigned

Number_Analysed.evidence: intervention group (n=10) receiving tobramycin-impregnated bone cement or the control group (n=5)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed significantly higher intraarticular tobramycin levels at 6 hours (median=31.8 μg/mL, p=0.002), 24 hours (median=17.1 μg/mL, p=0.002), and 48 hours (median=6.8 μg/mL, p=0.02) compared to the control group.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
